Overview.Title: Choose the proper fabricated explanation of weird reasoning in arguments
Overview.Text: John Doe, a fictive person from a far away, wrote several arguments to controversial issues. His reasoning is really weird, so it looks like he actually gives reasons against his standpoint.
Your task in this HIT batch will be to fill the gap and write down John's reasoning so his argument makes sense. This qualification will show you how a proper explanation must look like.
Of course, since John's reasoning is based on different commonsense knowledge, most of the explanation are fabricated. But the goal is to keep them as believable and relevant as possible.

List.ListItem: The explanation must relate to the content of the given reason and claim and actually explain the reasoning.
The explanation does not simply repeat or rephrases what's already said in the reason.
The explanation is kept short without necessary or distracting information.
The explanation avoids starting with "because", "the person says", "John says" or similar and avoids pronouns if possible.

QuestionContent.Title: Choose the proper explanation (see the criteria above) of John Doe's reasoning; the argument is about marijuana as a gateway drug:
QuestionContent.Text: Many patients have identified cannabis as an effective and safer alternative to their prescription drugs. And since [...explanation...], I claim that Marijuana is a gateway drug.

Selection.Text: many patients taking marijuana as an alternative medication are also hardcore drug users
cannabis is classified as a drug
